affected individuals have a homozygous missense mutation in DHCR24 leading to dramatically augmented plasma desmosterol levels. We thus establish a clear consistent phenotype of desmosterolosis (MIM 602398).

BP.term: negative regulation of cell population proliferation

MF.term: oxidoreductase activity, acting on the CH-CH group of donors, NAD or NADP as acceptor

name: 24-dehydrocholesterol reductase

smpdb.name: Chondrodysplasia Punctata II, X Linked Dominant (CDPX2)

wikipathways.name: Cholesterol metabolism (includes both Bloch and Kandutsch-Russell pathways)

summary: This gene encodes a flavin adenine dinucleotide (FAD)-dependent oxidoreductase which catalyzes the reduction of the delta-24 double bond of sterol intermediates during cholesterol biosynthesis. The protein contains a leader sequence that directs it to the endoplasmic reticulum membrane. Missense mutations in this gene have been associated with desmosterolosis. Also, reduced expression of the gene occurs in the temporal cortex of Alzheimer disease patients and overexpression has been observed in adrenal gland cancer cells. [provided by RefSeq, Jul 2008].
